one.statement: Debt Hell Your friend who lives in undisclosed country is involved in debt. He is borrowing 100,000-yen from a loan shark. The loan shark adds 5% interest of the debt and rounds it to the nearest 1,000 above week by week. Write a program which computes the amount of the debt in n weeks.
one.input_spec: An integer n (0 ≤ n ≤ 100) is given in a line.
one.output_spec: Print the amout of the debt in a line.
one.code_submission: import sys def main(): n = int(input().rstrip()) r = 1.05 digit = -4 a = 100000 print(int(round(a*(r**n), digit))) if __name__ == '__main__': main()

two.statement: Read two integers and print their sum.
two.input_spec: Two integers, a and b (-1000 <= a, b <= 1000), separated by a space on a single line.
two.output_spec: Print a single integer, which is the sum of a and b.
two.code_submission:
a, b = map(int, input().split())
print(a + b)

three.statement: Read two integers and print their sum.
three.input_spec: Two integers, a and b (-1000 <= a, b <= 1000), separated by a space on a single line.
three.output_spec: Print a single integer, which is the sum of a and b.
three.code_submission:
a, b = map(int, input().split())
print(a - b)
